channel.title: Range Problem
channel.description:
I want it so i range darts, not have to actually stand close, eg:
[URL=http://img227.imageshack.us/i/helpnq.png/][IMG]http://img227.imageshack.us/img227/9639/helpnq.png[/img][/URL]
Uploaded with [URL=http://imageshack.us]ImageShack.us[/URL]

item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

Mendorphins:

Probably each type of range weapon. Best person to speak to may be I Vain I.

Ill look into it, thanks.

item.title: Range Problem
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“Ddragonimp, post:13, topic:377105”]Lolz this is No help what so ever because it still requires an arrow lolz…

You need to hard code in a new Range
then instead of useBow = true;
you will need to make
useDart = true;

then look for all your UseBow == true
and Copy paste (SIMPLEST WAY)
all the same formulas and then Edit Item Id’s…[/quote]

I find the nonbow range method, but they are already added there, so yea =\

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:7, topic:377105”]I found in PI servers that “range” only works once you used a special attack (on a bow). There’s a number you need to change that determines how many squares the range weapon fires from. I haven’t come across this in PI yet though, so I can’t tell you where.

Also, make sure you declare the weapon in question to a range weapon. There should be an array if you look for it.[/quote]

Ive declared it.

Is there a seperate code for each range weapon (the squares thing?)

Read full topic

item.title: Range Problem
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

[quote=“z rowt21, post:6, topic:377105”]You need to set the item as a bow and an arrow
Plz rep++ me[/quote]

Lolz this is No help what so ever because it still requires an arrow lolz…

You need to hard code in a new Range
then instead of useBow = true;
you will need to make
useDart = true;

then look for all your UseBow == true
and Copy paste (SIMPLEST WAY)
all the same formulas and then Edit Item Id’s…

Read full topic

item.title: Range Problem
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

I found in PI servers that “range” only works once you used a special attack (on a bow). There’s a number you need to change that determines how many squares the range weapon fires from. I haven’t come across this in PI yet though, so I can’t tell you where.

Also, make sure you declare the weapon in question to a range weapon. There should be an array if you look for it.

Read full topic
